transforms.code:
# Create the "All Systems" entry as a dictionary
	all_systems_entry = {
	    'value': 0,
	    'label': 'All Systems'
	}
	
	modified_result = [all_systems_entry] 

	# Format and sort the names 
	formatted_names = sorted([{"value": item["id"], "label": item["name"]} for item in value],key=lambda x: x['label'].lower())
	modified_result.extend(formatted_names)
	
	return modified_result

# Create the "All Systems" entry as a dictionary
	all_systems_entry = {
	    'value': 0,
	    'label': 'All Lines'
	}
	
	modified_result = [all_systems_entry] 

	# Format and sort the names 
	formatted_names = sorted([{"value": item["id"], "label": item["name"]} for item in value],key=lambda x: x['label'].lower())
	modified_result.extend(formatted_names)
	
	return modified_result

# Create the "All Systems" entry as a dictionary
	all_systems_entry = {
	    'value': 0,
	    'label': 'All Circuits'
	}
	
	modified_result = [all_systems_entry] 

	# Format and sort the names 
	formatted_names = sorted([{"value": item["id"], "label": item["name"]+' - '+item['description']} for item in value],key=lambda x: x['label'].lower())
	modified_result.extend(formatted_names)
	
	return modified_result

# Create the "All Systems" entry as a dictionary
	states = [
			{"value": "All States", "label": "All States"},
		    {"value": "Completed", "label": "Completed"},
		    {"value": "Stopped", "label": "Stopped"},
		    {"value": "In Progress", "label": "In Progress"},
		    {"value": "Aborted", "label": "Aborted"}
		]
	
	return states

config.script:
import json
	import os
	from java.util import Calendar, Date
	
	self.props.path='material/hourglass_bottom'

		
	# Create a calendar instance for manipulation
	calendar = Calendar.getInstance()
	
	# Set time_end to the current time
	time_end = Date(calendar.getTimeInMillis())
	
	# Adjust the calendar to one day ago
	calendar.add(Calendar.DATE, -1)
	
	# Set time_start to one day ago
	time_start = Date(calendar.getTimeInMillis())
	
	# Set parameters
	site_id = 			self.parent.parent.getChild("CurrentSite").props.params.site_id
	system_id = 		self.parent.getChild("System").getChild("Dropdown_System").props.value
	line_id = 			self.parent.getChild("Line").getChild("Dropdown_Line").props.value
	circuit_id =		self.parent.getChild("Circuit").getChild("Dropdown_Circuit").props.value
	
	
	# Call script to get CIPs since last run
	CIP_P.Aggregator.main_get_all_cip_events(time_start, time_end,site_id,system_id,line_id,circuit_id)
	
	self.props.path='material/refresh'
	
	# Update the table
	system.perspective.sendMessage("update_bindings", payload = {}, scope = "page")

if event.column == 'notes':
		
		# Make sure we have edit permission to do this
			if (not CORE_P.User.hasPermission(self, Constants_P.PROJECT['project_name'], 'SITEADMIN')):
				CORE_P.Utils.helpPopup("Missing user rights. Please log in")
				return
			
			try:
			
				# Get all the parameters we need to save
				event_id		=self.props.selection.data[0].id
				event_note 		= event.value
				updated_by		= self.session.props.auth.user.userName
				
				namedQuery = "CIP_Q/DB_Update/Update_Event_Note"
				parameters = {
								'id':				event_id, 
								'note':				event_note,
								'updated_by':		updated_by,
							}
							
				affected_rows = system.db.runNamedQuery(system.project.getProjectName(), namedQuery, parameters)
			
			except:
			
				CORE_P.Utils.errorPopup('Error changing Note:') #
			
			# Update the table
			system.perspective.sendMessage("update_bindings", payload = {}, scope = "page")

transforms.code:
from datetime import datetime
	
	if quality.toString() == "Bad_NotFound":
		return 'CIP Event Detail'
	
	if value != []:
	    selected_data = self.parent.parent.getChild("Events").getChild("Table").props.selection.data[0]
	    
	    # Convert milliseconds to seconds
	    start_time_seconds = selected_data.time_start / 1000
	    end_time_seconds = selected_data.time_end / 1000
	    
	    # Convert seconds to datetime objects
	    start_datetime = datetime.fromtimestamp(start_time_seconds)
	    end_datetime = datetime.fromtimestamp(end_time_seconds)
	    
	    # Format datetime objects to desired format
	    start_formatted = start_datetime.strftime('%m/%d/%y %H:%M:%S')
	    end_formatted = end_datetime.strftime('%m/%d/%y %H:%M:%S')
	    
	    title = (
	        str(selected_data.System) + ' - ' +
	        str(selected_data.Line) + ' - ' +
	        str(selected_data.Circuit) + ' - ' +
	        'Event Number: ' + str(selected_data.id)
	    )
	    return title
	else:
	    return 'Event Detail'

transforms.code: return str(value)+'px'

# This will hold all series
	seriesList = []
	
	# Get the number of rows and columns in the dataset
	rowCount = value.getRowCount()
	columnCount = value.getColumnCount()
	
	# Loop through each column to check if it contains 'Cond' in its name
	for colIndex in range(columnCount):
		columnName = value.getColumnName(colIndex)
		
		# Check for key words
		if 'Temp' in columnName:
			# Prepare the list for this specific series
			valueList = []
			
			# Iterate over each row to get the data points for this column
			for rowIndex in range(rowCount):
			    # Get the timestamp from the first column
			    timeStamp = value.getValueAt(rowIndex, 't_stamp')
			    # Get the item value from the current column
			    itemValue = value.getValueAt(rowIndex, colIndex)
			
			    # Create a dictionary for the x and y values
			    valueDict = {
			        "x": timeStamp,
			        "y": itemValue
			    }
			    valueList.append(valueDict)
			    
			if 'Supply' in columnName:
				color = '#3498DB'

			else:
				color = '#E59866'

				
			if 'Trans' in columnName:
				ctype = 'line'
				
			else:
				ctype = 'area'
				
			
			# Append the series to the series list with the column name as the series name
			seriesList.append({
			    "name": columnName,
			    "data": valueList,
			    "color": color,
			    "type":ctype
			})
	
	return seriesList

ValueList=[]

	for row in range(value.getRowCount()):
		TimeStamp = value.getValueAt(row, 0)
		ItemValue = value.getValueAt(row, 1)
		
		ValueDict = {}
		ValueDict["x"] = TimeStamp
		ValueDict["y"] = ItemValue
		ValueList.append(ValueDict)
		
	return ValueList
return str(value)+'px'

events=value['events']
	steps=value['steps']
	
	# Initialize an empty list to store the result
	held_result =[]
	paused_result =[]
	step_result=[]
	result=[]
		
	# Iterate over the dataset and adjust the timestamps
	for row in range(len(events)):
	
		if events[row]['event_type']==2:
			
			paused_dict = {
			        "x":  events[row]['time_start'],
			        "x2": events[row]['time_end'],
			        "strokeDashArray": 1,
			        "borderColor": "#775DD0",
			        "opacity": 0.2,
			        "fillColor": "#FFFF8A"
			        }
			paused_result.append(paused_dict)
			
		if events[row]['event_type']==3:
			
			held_dict = {
			        "x":  events[row]['time_start'],
			        "x2": events[row]['time_end'],
			        "strokeDashArray": 1,
			        "borderColor": "#775DD0",
			        "opacity": 0.2,
			        "fillColor": "#FFFF8A"
			        }
			held_result.append(held_dict)
			
	# Iterate over the dataset and adjust the timestamps
	for row in range(len(steps)):
	
		# Construct a new dictionary with the desired format
		step_dict = {
		    "x": steps[row]['time_start'],
		    "strokeDashArray": 1,
		    "borderColor": "#99A3A4",
		    "label": {
		        "borderColor": "#775DD0",
		        "style": {
		            "color": "#555555",
		            "background": "#CCFFFF",
		            "fontSize": "8px"
		            },
		        "text": "",
		        "position": "bottom"
		    }
		}
		step_result.append(step_dict)
	
	result.extend(paused_result)
	result.extend(held_result)
	result.extend(step_result)
			
	
	
	if len(result)>0:
		return result
	else:
		return []

return str(value)+'px'

events=value['events']
	steps=value['steps']
	
	# Initialize an empty list to store the result
	held_result =[]
	paused_result =[]
	step_result=[]
	result=[]
		
	# Iterate over the dataset and adjust the timestamps
	for row in range(len(events)):
	
		if events[row]['event_type']==2:
			
			paused_dict = {
			        "x":  events[row]['time_start'],
			        "x2": events[row]['time_end'],
			        "strokeDashArray": 1,
			        "borderColor": "#775DD0",
			        "opacity": 0.2,
			        "fillColor": "#FFFF8A"
			        }
			paused_result.append(paused_dict)
			
		if events[row]['event_type']==3:
			
			held_dict = {
			        "x":  events[row]['time_start'],
			        "x2": events[row]['time_end'],
			        "strokeDashArray": 1,
			        "borderColor": "#775DD0",
			        "opacity": 0.2,
			        "fillColor": "#FFFF8A"
			        }
			held_result.append(held_dict)
			
	# Iterate over the dataset and adjust the timestamps
	for row in range(len(steps)):
	
		if value['labels']==True:
			label_text = ''
		else:
			label_text =  steps[row]["step_description"]
	
		# Construct a new dictionary with the desired format
		step_dict = {
		    "x": steps[row]["time_start"],
		    "strokeDashArray": 1,
		    "borderColor": "#99A3A4",
		    "label": {
		        "borderColor": "#ECF0F1",
		        "style": {
		            "color": "#FFFFFF",
		            "background": "#000000",
		            "fontSize": "8px"
		            },
		        "text":label_text,
		        "position": "bottom",
		        "borderRadius":8,
		        "offsetX":5
		    }
		}
		step_result.append(step_dict)
	
	result.extend(paused_result)
	result.extend(held_result)
	result.extend(step_result)
			
	
	
	if len(result)>0:
		return result
	else:
		return []

# This will hold all series
	seriesList = []
	
	# Get the number of rows and columns in the dataset
	rowCount = value.getRowCount()
	columnCount = value.getColumnCount()
	
	# Loop through each column to check if it contains 'Cond' in its name
	for colIndex in range(columnCount):
		columnName = value.getColumnName(colIndex)
		
		# Check for key words
		if 'Step Number' in columnName:
			# Prepare the list for this specific series
			valueList = []
			
			# Iterate over each row to get the data points for this column
			for rowIndex in range(rowCount):
			    # Get the timestamp from the first column
			    timeStamp = value.getValueAt(rowIndex, 't_stamp')
			    # Get the item value from the current column
			    itemValue = value.getValueAt(rowIndex, colIndex)
			    itemValue2 = value.getValueAt(rowIndex, 'Step Description')
			
			    # Create a dictionary for the x and y values
			    valueDict = {
			        "x": timeStamp,
			        "y": itemValue,
			        "y2": itemValue2
			    }
			    valueList.append(valueDict)
			    
			color = '#3498DB'
			ctype = 'line'
			
			# Append the series to the series list with the column name as the series name
			seriesList.append({
			    "name": columnName,
			    "data": valueList,
			    "color": color,
			    "type":ctype
			})
	
	return seriesList
return str(value*5-40)+'px'

data =value['events']
	transformed_data = []
	
	for row in range(len(data)):
	
		local_dt_start = CIP_P.Utilities.get_local_dt(data[row]['time_start'], value['timezone'])
		local_dt_end = CIP_P.Utilities.get_local_dt(data[row]['time_end'], value['timezone'])
		
		newRow = {
		            'event_type': data[row]['type_event'],
		            'time_start': local_dt_start,
		            'time_end': local_dt_end
		        }
		        
		# Append the new row to the list of transformed data
		transformed_data.append(newRow)
	
	return transformed_data

data =value['steps']
	transformed_data = []
	
	for row in range(len(data)):

		local_dt_start = CIP_P.Utilities.get_local_dt(data[row]['time_start'], value['timezone'])
		local_dt_end = CIP_P.Utilities.get_local_dt(data[row]['time_end'], value['timezone'])

		newRow = {
		            'step_description': data[row]['step_description'],
		            'time_start': local_dt_start,
		            'time_end': local_dt_end
		        }
	        
		# Append the new row to the list of transformed data
		transformed_data.append(newRow)
	
	return transformed_data

# Return an empty list if there are no items in the value
    if len(value) == 0:
        return []
        
    alias_mapping = {
    	'step_number': 'Step Number',
    	'step_description': 'Step Description',
		'supply_temp_transmitter': 'Supply Trans Temp',
		'supply_flow_transmitter': 'Supply Trans Flow',
		'supply_press_transmitter': 'Supply Trans Press',
		'supply_cond_transmitter': 'Supply Trans Cond',
		'supply_temp_switch': 'Supply Switch Temp',
		'supply_flow_switch': 'Supply Switch Flow',
		'supply_press_switch': 'Supply Switch Press',
		'supply_cond_switch': 'Supply Switch Cond',
		'return_temp_transmitter': 'Return Trans Temp',
		'return_flow_transmitter': 'Return Trans Flow',
		'return_press_transmitter': 'Return Trans Press',
		'return_cond_transmitter': 'Return Trans Cond',
		'return_temp_switch': 'Return Switch Temp',
		'return_flow_switch': 'Return Switch Flow',
		'return_press_switch': 'Return Switch Press',
		'return_cond_switch': 'Return Switch Cond',
    	}

    # Initialize an empty list to store the result
    transformed_result = []
    
    # Iterate through each dictionary in the query result
    for entry in value:
	    for key, tag_path in entry.items():
	    	if tag_path == None:
	    		continue
	        # Create a new dictionary for each entry
	        new_dict = {
	            "aggregate": self.custom.settings.AggregationMode,  # Assuming this is correctly accessible
	            "alias": alias_mapping.get(key, key),
	            "path": CORE_P.Tags.getFullyQualifiedTagName(tag_path)  # Assuming you want the entire entry included; adjust if 'path' is supposed to be specific
	        }
	        # Add the new dictionary to the result list
	        transformed_result.append(new_dict)
	        
	    return transformed_result
